ProjectTitle: Speaking from the Sides: Marginal Annotation and the Collection of Knowledge in Early Medieval Syriac Christianity
InitialFeedbackHistory:
08/07/2022
Have you considered using tools that can help with data management? If you havenâ€™t tried out a reference manager like Zotero (www.zotero.org) yet, we heartily recommend those. They're easy to use, have a lot of handy document organization features, and can save you time when you start writing to publish. Tropy (https://tropy.org) may also be useful, Tropy is free and specifically designed to organize and annotate archival images. For qualitative data analysis of primarily textual information (text mining) NVivo may be handy, for more information: https://admin.kuleuven.be/icts/english/research/software/Nvivo/nvivo. 
If you like to learn more about these and other tools you can always request a meeting via rdm@kuleuven.be.
label: good with suggestions
